item.title: Constant fly tipping, 17th October
item.description:
There is constant flytipping by the recycling bins behind Pine House on Albion St, with new large furniture items deposited weekly. This sofa has been there two weeks now and there are two large mattresses and a large metal cabinet by the food waste on the other side of the road by Pine House itself. The issue has got significantly worse since summer as the recycling has stopped being collected sufficiently often. This leads to bags piling up and then being torn across the road, which encourages people to use it as a dumping ground. For example here there is dirty nappies and food smeared over the road here. This obviously creates more mess for the council. If the collections cannot be increased, we urgently need an additional recycling bin to keep the rubbish sanitary and to discourage the constant fly tipping. We would be so grateful for help as it is right by the front doors and it is affecting residents to live next to unsafe and open waste.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albion Street, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree removed and never replaced, 17th October
item.description:
Tree removed several years ago (in front of 29 Ryecroft) and never replaced. Large hole in the ground where tree stump was located, which is also a trip hazard as concealed by high grass. Tree pit already prepared, so should be an easy plant. Please add to this season’s planting list
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ryecroft Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leafs, 17th October
item.description:
